skill.name: code-review-excellence
skill.description: Master effective code review practices to provide constructive feedback, catch bugs early, and foster knowledge sharing while maintaining team morale. Use when reviewing pull requests, establishing review standards, or mentoring developers.
skill.summary: Master effective code review practices to provide constructive feedback, catch bugs early, and foste...

security_audit.summary: No executable code or network activity is present. Content is guidance only and aligns with stated purpose.

content.user_title: Improve code reviews with clear, actionable feedback
content.value_statement: Code reviews can feel slow, subjective, and unhelpful. This skill gives structured phases, checklists, and language-specific tips to deliver high-quality reviews.
actual_capabilities: Provides a phased review process from context to decision
Supplies security, performance, and testing checklists
Offers feedback phrasing patterns and severity labels
Includes language-specific review tips for Python and TypeScript
Provides a PR review comment template
limitations: Does not access repositories or PRs without user input
Does not execute tests or analyze runtime behavior
Does not replace automated linters or security scanners
Requires code context to give specific feedback

use_cases.title: Set team review standards
use_cases.description: Create consistent review expectations and templates for a growing team.

use_cases.title: Mentor through reviews
use_cases.description: Provide constructive feedback that teaches without blocking progress.

use_cases.title: Strengthen review rigor
use_cases.description: Use security and testing checklists to catch high-risk issues.

prompt_templates.title: Quick PR review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this change summary and highlight any risks, edge cases, or tests to add. Code context: [paste].

prompt_templates.title: Structured review
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a phased code review with findings labeled by severity. Include strengths, required changes, and suggestions.

prompt_templates.title: Security-focused review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review for security issues only. Focus on input validation, auth checks, and sensitive data handling.

prompt_templates.title: Architecture review
prompt_templates.prompt: Assess design fit, scalability, and alternatives. List tradeoffs and questions for the author.

output_examples.input: Review this PR that adds a new payment endpoint and tests.
output: Strengths: Clear separation of controller and service layers.
Blocking: Missing authorization check for account ownership.
Important: Add tests for declined payments and timeouts.
Suggestion: Extract tax calculation into a reusable helper.

best_practices: Ask clarifying questions before requesting changes
Label severity to reduce unnecessary blocking

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. It is a text-based skill and works across major assistant platforms.

faq.question: What are the main limits?
faq.answer: It cannot access repos or run tests. You must provide code and context.

faq.question: Can it integrate with GitHub or GitLab?
faq.answer: It does not integrate directly. Paste PR details or diffs to use it.

faq.question: Does it access or store my code?
faq.answer: No. It uses only the content you provide during the session.

faq.question: What if the review feels too generic?
faq.answer: Provide more context, goals, and risk areas to make feedback specific.

faq.question: How does it compare to automated linters?
faq.answer: It complements tools by focusing on design, logic, and review communication.
